00017 package WeBWorK::Authen::LDAP;
00018 use base qw/WeBWorK::Authen/;
00019 
00020 use strict;
00021 use warnings;
00022 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00023 use Net::LDAP qw/LDAP_INVALID_CREDENTIALS/;
00024 
00025 sub checkPassword {
00026     my ($self, $userID, $possibleClearPassword) = @_;
00027     my $ce = $self->{r}->ce;
00028     my $failover = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{failover};
00029     
00030     debug("LDAP module is doing the password checking.\n");
00031     
00032     # check against LDAP server
00033     my $ret = $self->ldap_authen_uid($userID, $possibleClearPassword);
00034     return 1 if ($ret == 1);
00035 
00036     #return 0 if ($userID !~ /admin/);
00037     
00038     # optional: fail over to superclass checkPassword
00039     if (($failover eq "all" or $failover == 1) || ($failover eq "local" and $ret < 0)) {
00040         $self->write_log_entry("AUTH LDAP: authentication failed, deferring to superclass");
00041         return $self->SUPER::checkPassword($userID, $possibleClearPassword);
00042     }
00043     
00044     # fail by default
00045     return 0;
00046 }
00047 
00048 sub ldap_authen_uid {
00049     my ($self, $uid, $password) = @_;
00050     my $ce = $self->{r}->ce;
00051     my $hosts = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{net_ldap_hosts};
00052     my $opts = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{net_ldap_opts};
00053     my $base = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{net_ldap_base};
00054         my $searchdn = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{searchDN};
00055     my $bindAccount = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{bindAccount};
00056         my $bindpassword = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{bindPassword};
00057     # Be backwards-compatible with releases that hardcode this value.
00058     my $rdn = "sAMAccountName";
00059     if (defined $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{net_ldap_rdn}) {
00060         $rdn = $ce->{authen}{ldap_options}{net_ldap_rdn};
00061     }
00062 
00063 
00064     
00065     # connect to LDAP server
00066     my $ldap = new Net::LDAP($hosts, @$opts);
00067     if (not defined $ldap) {
00068         warn "AUTH LDAP: couldn't connect to any of ", join(", ", @$hosts), ".\n";
00069         return 0;
00070     }
00071     
00072     my $msg;
00073     
00074     
00075     if($bindAccount){
00076         # bind with a bind USER
00077             $msg = $ldap->bind( $searchdn, password => $bindpassword );
00078             if ($msg->is_error) {
00079                     warn "AUTH LDAP: bind error ", $msg->code, ": ", $msg->error_text, ".\n";
00080                     return 0;
00081         }
00082     }
00083     else{
00084     # bind anonymously
00085         $msg = $ldap->bind;
00086         if ($msg->is_error) {
00087             warn "AUTH LDAP: bind error ", $msg->code, ": ", $msg->error_text, ".\n";
00088             return 0;
00089         }   
00090     }
00091     
00092     # look up user's DN
00093     $msg = $ldap->search(base => $base, filter => "$rdn=$uid");
00094     if ($msg->is_error) {
00095         warn "AUTH LDAP: search error ", $msg->code, ": ", $msg->error_text, ".\n",$searchdn,"\n",$base,"\n",$uid,"\n";
00096         return 0;
00097     }
00098     if ($msg->count > 1) {
00099         warn "AUTH LDAP: more than one result returned when searching for UID '$uid'.\n";
00100         return 0;
00101     }
00102     if ($msg->count == 0) {
00103         $self->write_log_entry("AUTH LDAP: UID not found");
00104         return -1;
00105     }
00106     my $dn = $msg->shift_entry->dn;
00107     if (not defined $dn) {
00108         warn "AUTH LDAP: got null DN when looking up UID '$uid'.\n";
00109         return 0;
00110     }
00111     
00112     # re-bind as user. if that works, we've authenticated!
00113     $msg = $ldap->bind($dn, password => $password);
00114     if ($msg->code == LDAP_INVALID_CREDENTIALS) {
00115         $self->write_log_entry("AUTH LDAP: server rejected password for UID.");
00116         return 0;
00117     }
00118     if ($msg->is_error) {
00119         warn "AUTH LDAP: bind error ", $msg->code, ": ", $msg->error_text, ".\n";
00120         return 0;
00121     }
00122     
00123     # it worked! we win!
00124     return 1;
00125 }
00126 
00127 1;
